data.title: Austin Powers 2: Did Robert Wagner dubbed Rob Lowe's lines?
data.text:
It's Lowe -- I've seen him do his Wagner impression on talk shows.

John

In article <7k9a7t$puv$1...@hiram.io.com>,

pat...@fnord.io.com (Patman) wrote:

> In Austin Powers 2, Dr. Evil goes back in time to 1969, and when

> he does, he meets up with the younger version of Dr. Evil's #2,

> Robert Wagner's character, who gets played by Rob Lowe as the

> younger version of #2. What I want to know is if that's Rob Lowe's

> voice, or is it Robert Wagner's Voice that's dubbed over Rob Lowe's

> dialogue as #2. I say it's Wagner's voice dubbed over Lowe's lines,

> but according to Lowe on the Daily Show, he says he's doing an

> impression of Wagner's voice (this was second hand reporting, I

> did not see the Daily show segment in question). Anyone know

> for sure, and want to venture their opinion? TIA.

>

> --

> ************** A random quote from Heathers: ************

> "People love you, but *I* know you."

> *** My WWW home page: http://www.io.com/~patman/ *****

>

--

Visit my movie review archive at

http://www.angelfire.com/on/Alberich/index.html

Sent via Deja.com http://www.deja.com/

Share what you know. Learn what you don't.

On Wed, 16 Jun 1999 23:30:40 GMT, Duane Stark <dua...@home.com> wrote:

>I saw him on the Daily show and Jon Stewart had Rob do the Robert

>Wagner voice. He had it down, you would have thought it was Wagner.

Damn, I'm impressed! When I heard him in the film, my first

reaction was to lean over to my wife and say, "Lowe's doing a

*great* Robert Wagner impression". She listened for a few more

lines, and said, "I think Wagner is dubbing the voice".

After a few more minutes, the "Wagner voice" seemed so perfect

that I was inclined to agree with her.

Now that I find that it really *was* Lowe, I must congratulate

him on an *impeccable* impression. Great work.
